Further, a coating material and an organic-inorganic composite film were fabricated using the organic-inorganic composite W according to the same method as in Example 19. Evaluation results are shown in Table 10. A substrate in which a hard coat layer was formed on TAC of Example 14 was used.
description.heading: [Example 44: (beaded SiO2/TiO2)-g-p(MMA/HEMA/AOI); all-process integrated synthesis and photo-radical curing]
description.p:
A mixture solution A was fabricated according to the following procedure.
Mixture solution A: A beaded silica solution B ("MIBK-ST-UP") and a tiania solution were mixed in the ratio of 9:1 by a volume ratio to obtain 20 mass% (beaded SiO2+TiO2)/MIBK solution.
A BIDS-reformed mixture solution A was fabricated according to the same method as in Example 26 except that the above-described mixture solution A was used in place of the beaded silica solution B ("MIBK-ST-UP") of Example 26. A part of the mixture solution was washed and dried, and halogen content was measured to be 0.1 mass%. Since chlorine was not detected, bromine content is shown as the halogen content.
Subsequently, an organic-inorganic composite X was obtained according to the same method as in Example 26. Evaluation results are shown in table 7.
Further, a coating material and an organic-inorganic composite film were produced using the organic-inorganic composite X according to the same method as in Example 19. Evaluation results are shown in Table 10. A substrate in which a hard coat layer was formed on TAC of Example 14 was used.

It has been found from the experiment results shown in Tables 4 to 11 that: a polymer layer in which the length of the polymer chain has matched is formed and each organic-inorganic composite is independently generated without being bonded, by synthesizing a polymer by a living radical polymerization method from a polymerization initiating group bonded to an inorganic particle, and; an organic-inorganic composite film in which a void content with respect to an inorganic filling amount can be easily increased is obtained, as an amount of free polymers filling the voids is less. Further, it has been found that an organic-inorganic composite film having excellent solvent-resistant characteristic and high film strength is obtained by curing the organic-inorganic composite film.
The organic-inorganic composite, the coating material, and the organic-inorganic composite film according to the present embodiment are useful, for example, as an optical material and a coating film.

claim.claim-text: An organic-inorganic composite film comprising: an organic-inorganic composite including: an inorganic compound particle; and a polymer bonded to the inorganic compound particle, wherein a percentage of voids in the film is 3 to 70 volume% with reference to a volume of the film.
The organic-inorganic composite film according to claim 1, wherein the inorganic compound particle is an inorganic oxide particle.
The organic-inorganic composite film according to claim 2, wherein the inorganic oxide particle form a chain structure including a plurality of primary particles linked in a beaded shape.
The organic-inorganic composite film according to claim 1 or 2, wherein a circularity of the inorganic compound particle is 0.5 to 1.
The organic-inorganic composite film according to any one of claims 1 to 4, wherein the inorganic compound particle and the polymer are bonded through a coupling agent.

The organic-inorganic composite according to claim 5, wherein the coupling agent has a structure represented by the following formula 1:
X-Si(R1)(R2)(R3) (Formula 1)
in the formula, X denotes a polymerization initiating group, R1 and R2 independently denote an alkyl group having 1 to 10 carbon atoms respectively, and R3 denotes an alkoxy group having 1 to 10 carbon atoms, a hydrogen atom, a hydroxyl group or a halogen atom.
The organic-inorganic composite film according to any one of claims 1 to 6, wherein a molecular weight distribution of the polymer is equal to or less than 2.3.
The organic-inorganic composite film according to any one of claims 1 to 7, wherein the polymer contains a methacrylic acid ester or an acrylic acid ester as a monomer unit.
The organic-inorganic composite film according to any one of claims 1 to 8, wherein the polymer contains at least one crosslinkable functional group.
The organic-inorganic composite film according to claim 9, wherein the crosslinkable functional group contains at least one reactive double bond.
The organic-inorganic composite film according to claim 9 or 10, wherein the reactive double bond is a carbon-carbon double bond in a (meta) acryloyl group.
The organic-inorganic composite film according to any one of claims 1 to 11, wherein a number average molecular weight Mn of the polymer is 10000 to 100000 g/mol.

The organic-inorganic composite film according to any one of claims 1 to 12, wherein a content of the inorganic compound particle is 70 to 96 mass% with reference to a total mass of the organic-inorganic composite.

The organic-inorganic composite film according to any one of claims 1 to 13, wherein a content of the inorganic compound particle is 55 to 94 volume% with reference to a total volume of the organic-inorganic composite.
The organic-inorganic composite film according to any one of claims 1 to 14, having a refractive index of 0.020 or more lower than a theoretical refractive index.
The organic-inorganic composite film according to any one of claims 1 to 15, having a refractive index of equal to or less than 1.42.
The organic-inorganic composite film according to any one of claims 1 to 16, having a minimum reflectance of equal to or less than 1.5%.
The organic-inorganic composite film according to any one of claims 1 to 17, having a pencil hardness of equal to or more than F.

The organic-inorganic composite film according to any one of claims 1 to 18, wherein the organic-inorganic composite further includes a free polymer not bonded to the inorganic compound particle, and a percentage of the free polymer is equal to or less than 30 mass% with reference to a total mass of the free polymer and the polymer bonded to the inorganic compound particle.
The organic-inorganic composite film according to any one of claims 1 to 19, wherein the organic-inorganic composite is crosslinked.
The organic-inorganic composite film according to claim 20, wherein the organic-inorganic composite is crosslinked by radical polymerization.
The organic-inorganic composite film according to claim 20 or 21, wherein the organic-inorganic composite is further crosslinked by a crosslinker.

A coating material to form an organic-inorganic composite film according to any one of claims 1 to 22 through coating, the coating material comprising: an organic-inorganic composite including: an inorganic compound particle; and a polymer bonded to the inorganic compound particle.
The coating material according to claim 23, further comprising an organic solvent.
The coating material according to claim 23 or 24, further comprising a photo-polymerization initiator or a curing agent.
The coating material according to any one of claims 23 to 25, wherein a solid content concentration is 0.2 to 50 mass%.
The coating material according to any one of claims 23 to 26, having a viscosity of equal to or less than 5 Pa·s.

The organic-inorganic composite film according to any one of claims 1 to 22, produced by a method including the following steps 1 and 2: Step 1: reacting the inorganic compound particle with a coupling agent having a polymerization initiating group, to obtain a surface-reformed inorganic compound particle; and Step 2: forming the polymer bonded to the inorganic compound particle through living radical polymerization of a radical polymerizable monomer initiated by the polymerization initiating group, to produce the organic-inorganic composite.

The organic-inorganic composite film according to any one of claims 20 to 22, produced by a method including the following steps 1, 2 and 3: Step 1: reacting the inorganic compound particle with a coupling agent having a polymerization initiating group, to obtain a surface-reformed inorganic compound particle; Step 2: forming the polymer bonded to the inorganic compound particle through living radical polymerization of a radical polymerizable monomer initiated by the polymerization initiating group, to produce the organic-inorganic composite; and Step 3: bonding a compound having a crosslinkable functional group including a reactive double bond to the organic-inorganic composite after Step 2.

The organic-inorganic composite film according to any one of claims 1 to 22, produced by a method including the following steps 4 and 5: Step 4: reacting a coupling agent having a polymerization initiating group and a hydrophobizing agent with the inorganic compound particle, to obtain a surface-reformed inorganic compound particle; and Step 5: forming the polymer bonded to the inorganic compound particle through living radical polymerization of a radical polymerizable monomer initiated by the polymerization initiating group, to produce the organic-inorganic composite after Step 4.

The organic-inorganic composite film according to any one of claims 20 to 22, produced by a method including the following steps 4, 5 and 6: Step 4: reacting a coupling agent having a polymerization initiating group and a hydrophobizing agent with the inorganic compound particle, to obtain a surface-reformed inorganic compound particle; Step 5: forming the polymer bonded to the inorganic compound particle through living radical polymerization of a radical polymerizable monomer initiated by the polymerization initiating group, to produce the organic-inorganic composite after Step 4; and Step 6: bonding a compound having a functional group including a reactive double bond to the organic-inorganic composite.
The organic-inorganic composite film according to any one of claims 28 to 31, wherein the living radical polymerization is an atom transfer radical polymerization.

A method of producing an organic-inorganic composite film according to any one of claims 1 to 19, the method comprising the steps of: obtaining a coating material that comprises an organic-inorganic composite including: an inorganic compound particle; and a polymer bonded to the inorganic compound particle; and applying the coating material to a substrate and removing the organic solvent from the applied coating material to form an organic-inorganic composite film.

A method of producing an organic-inorganic composite film according to any one of claims 20 to 22, the method comprising the steps of: obtaining a coating material that comprises an organic-inorganic composite including: an inorganic compound particle; and a polymer bonded to the inorganic compound particle; applying the coating material to a substrate and removing the organic solvent from the applied coating material to form an organic-inorganic composite film; and crosslinking the organic-inorganic composite through photo-curing or thermal curing.
An optical material comprising the organic-inorganic composite film according to any one of claims 1 to 22.
An optical member comprising the organic-inorganic composite film according to any one of claims 1 to 22.
An antireflection member comprising the organic-inorganic composite film according to any one of claims 1 to 22.
An optical element comprising the organic-inorganic composite film according to any one of claims 1 to 22.
An illumination apparatus comprising the organic-inorganic composite film according to any one of claims 1 to 22.
